sections.title: What is a KDP Reseller?
sections.content: What is a KDP Reseller?. The term _KDP_ stands for the Knox Deployment Program, which enables trusted Samsung device resellers to register devices for their enterprise customers. If you purchase devices from one of these resellers, you can then use Knox Configure (KC) and Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) to customize devices for your enterprise needs. Only devices purchased from participating resellers can be verified and uploaded to KC or KME through the program.

sections.title: Unable to reassign devices to a renewed license
sections.content: Unable to reassign devices to a renewed license. IT Admins might encounter an error when assigning devices previously activated on a license. Learn about how to resolve the issue. If you renew a Knox Configure Dynamic Edition Per Device license after the 30 day grace period, you may encounter the following error when attempting to reassign devices that were previously activated on the license: > Failed to assign devices > Could not assign profile _profile name_ to device(s). Please see details for errors. If the problem persists, contact Samsung Knox Support. When downloading the details, the following description is shown: > Failed to assign devices Cause For fleets with 1000 or more devices, there's an issue with the logic that checks if there are enough assignments left on the license. Resolution First, ensure that the device was previously activated on the license before the license expired: 1. On the Knox Admin Portal, go to Licenses. 2. Click Manage license keys. 3. Click Device Status. 4. Enter your Knox license key and device IMEIs associated with that license. 5. Click CHECK STATUS. If the devices were previously activated on the license, they can be reassigned. Devices must be assigned in bulk to the correct profile in batches of 1000 or less. Additional information For more information about how to manage Knox Configure licenses, refer to Manage licenses.

sections.title: Updates to device search from 23.09
sections.content: Updates to device search from 23.09. Starting with Knox Configure 23.09, the device search functionality has changed. Learn more about how to query the device list. Starting with Knox Configure 23.09, users are no longer able to search for devices by the following attributes: Profile, User ID, Model, Tags, Order number You can now only search for devices by IMEI/MEID, serial number, or custom ID. In addition, the search term must be an exact match. For example, searching for a custom ID of NewDevice would return NewDevice but not MyNewDevice or NewDeviceID. This change was made to improve the performance of the device search. The Samsung Knox Configure team is currently working to further improve the functionality of the device search. Workaround To perform advanced searches on the device list, download the list and filter the resulting CSV file.

sections.title: How long does it take to upload devices in the Knox Configure portal?
sections.content: How long does it take to upload devices in the Knox Configure portal?. Depending on the number of devices in your list, uploading them may take a few seconds to a few minutes. When complete, a status bar will show the results of each device upload: Upload devices, Valid devices, Invalid devices, Duplicate devices If there are any errors associated with these devices, click Details to view the Activity log.

sections.title: What's the difference between the delete and bulk delete actions?
sections.content: What's the difference between the delete and bulk delete actions?. The Delete button allows you to select devices listed in the Reseller Portal and delete them from Knox Configure. The Bulk delete button allows you to upload CSV files listing multiple device IDs that you can delete at the same time.

sections.title: Why do I get an error message when I try to add an admin to my Knox Configure tenant?
sections.content: Why do I get an error message when I try to add an admin to my Knox Configure tenant?. You might be experiencing an error because the admin you are inviting already has a SamsungKnox.com account. Please contact Samsung Knox Support for more information. Only Tenant Admins can manage and add other admins to Knox Configure. The Tenant Admin is the person who set up Knox Configure account for the enterprise. To learn more about administrator roles, see Administrators.

sections.title: Will customers receive an email when resellers upload devices on their behalf?
sections.content: Will customers receive an email when resellers upload devices on their behalf?. Yes, customers receive an email when resellers upload devices for them.

sections.title: Can I filter Activity logs by Upload ID?
sections.content: Can I filter Activity logs by Upload ID?. No. Currently, you can only sort device data by Upload ID.

sections.title: Do I have to specify whether I am uploading devices for Knox Configure or Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: Do I have to specify whether I am uploading devices for Knox Configure or Knox Mobile Enrollment?. No, after you upload devices for a customer, they determine whether to enroll those devices in Knox Mobile Enrolment, Knox Configure, or both.

sections.title: Knox Configure: Experience app
sections.content: Knox Configure: Experience app. Download the Knox Configure Experience virtual demo app for your smartphone or tablet to highlight the value proposition and customer benefits of Knox Configure. For smartphone (102 MB), For tablet (126 MB) _*"Knox Configure Experience app is optimized for devices with a screen resolution of WUXGA/FHD (2K) or higher (Galaxy Note 8, Tab S3, etc). The app may not work properly on devices with a screen resolution of WXGA or lower (Galaxy J Series, Tab A 8", Tab E, Tab Active 2, etc)._

sections.title: Where are the Knox Configure servers hosted?
sections.content: Where are the Knox Configure servers hosted?. Knox Configure is hosted by Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the US (for North/Central/South America and Caribbean) and Ireland (for the rest of world except China).

sections.title: How to decrease profile size in Knox Configure
sections.content: How to decrease profile size in Knox Configure. When creating or modifying a profile in Knox Configure (KC), you may encounter a 4002007 error: Your profile has exceeded 300 MB. Try compressing or removing the image and sound files and try saving the profile again. Otherwise, contact Samsung to increase the profile size capacity. Cause The default maximum profile size in Knox Configure is 300 MB. Profiles exceeding this limit may contain large images, sound files, document files, or uploaded applications. Resolution You can reduce the size of the public or internal applications in your profile to ensure your profile size is under the 300 MB limit: #For public applications: On the Add Applications and Widgets screen, instead of directly uploading the APK file to the KC profile with Upload Application, add the application using the Add from Google Play option. The Google Play store will need to be enabled for the applications to be able to be installed using this option. However, if you want to prevent end users from installing all other applications, you can whitelist specific applications to have the permission to be installed using the Installation allowlist feature under the Applications & Content page of your KC profile. Only the applications specified in this allowlist will be able to be installed on the device. Other applications will not be able to be installed even though Google Play is accessible. #For internal applications: If you want to install apps on your device from other trusted sources (i.e. FTP servers, company email), you can add bookmarks that link to these internal sources. Include these applications in the allowlist to ensure only trusted applications can be installed. Additional information , For more information on how to set up a KC profile, visit the Knox Configure admin guide. If you are unable to reduce your profile size using the methods above, please submit a support ticket from your Knox dashboard to request a profile limit increase.

sections.title: How to check if the"Prevent applications from being stopped"policy is enforced on an app
sections.content: How to check if the"Prevent applications from being stopped"policy is enforced on an app. If you applied the Prevent applications from being stopped policy to a device in Knox Configure (KC), this knowledge base article shows you how to check if an application is active, or if it is sleeping in Doze mode. This method is especially useful for devices running an Android OS version below 9, as there is no way to verify the application's running state in Settings. Prerequisites This guide assumes you are using a Windows computer with the following installed: 1. ADB Toolkit 2. Google Android USB driver How do I verify if an app is running on my device? To check the running state of an app on your device: 1. Navigate to Settings and enable Max power saving mode. The message "Security policy restricts you from stopping this application" appears. 2. Tap the Recent applications view. If an app appears in the list, the Prevent applications from being stopped policy is applied to it. How do I verify if an app is in sleep/Doze mode with ADB? #On your device: 1. Navigate to Settings > About phone > Software information. 2. Tap Build Number 7 times to enable Developer options. 3. Navigate to the Settings menu again. Under Developer options, enable USB Debugging. #On your computer: 1. Connect the device to your computer via USB. When a prompt appears on the computer asking if you want to allow access to the device's data, click Allow. If this is the first time the device is connected, an additional prompt with the computer's RSA key fingerprint appears. Click OK. 2. On the device, run the application you want to test on the phone. In this example, we are using the Google Chrome app (com.android.chrome). 3. In the Windows Start Menu search bar, type `cmd` and select Windows Command Prompt. #In the command prompt: Change your current directory to where you extracted your ADB files. To do so, paste in the line below and replace the file path: `cd ` Then, run the following ADB command to initiate the ADB connection between device and computer, and simulate the device being unplugged from USB: `adb shell dumpsys battery unplug` Ensure that the app you are testing is running in the background. To get the app's activity status, enter the following ADB command: `adb shell am get-inactive com.android.chrome` `Idle=false` is printed on a new line, indicating that the application is actively running and not in sleep/Doze mode. Run the following ADB command to set the application to sleep or Doze mode: `adb shell am set-inactive com.android.chrome true` Then, run the earlier command to get the status of the app again: `adb shell am get-inactive com.android.chrome` If the result is `Idle=true`, the app was successfully put to sleep. If the result is `Idle=false`, there is a device policy preventing the app from entering sleep/Doze mode. For example, this command prompt window demonstrates what you see if this policy is not enforced on the device: After testing is complete, run the following command to establish the USB connection again: `adb shell dumpsys battery reset`

sections.title: What happens to my Knox Configure license if a device is lost or damaged?
sections.content: What happens to my Knox Configure license if a device is lost or damaged?. If your device is lost or damaged and you want to change the device IMEI associated with your Knox Configure license, you may request a Device IMEI/Serial Number Swap by contacting your local Samsung sales office. You will be asked to provide proof of the IMEI change. For example, you can share an invoice with the device's original IMEI along with an invoice from an authorized service center documenting the repair. After your request's status is approved, the new device's IMEI shows in your Knox Configure console without affecting the license count.

sections.title: Can an app installed through Knox Configure receive updates from Google Play?
sections.content: Can an app installed through Knox Configure receive updates from Google Play?. Yes, apps can receive updates from Google Play as long as the Play Store recognizes the app signature. Ensure the package isn't blocked on the Knox Configure console. To learn how to check your package blocklist, see _Application update restrictions_ in the Knox Configure admin guide. For additional information about app signing, see the Android Developer documentation.

sections.title: How to collect dumpstate logs on wearable devices
sections.content: How to collect dumpstate logs on wearable devices. You might need to help troubleshoot a wearable device issue by getting a log of the device's activities. This knowledge base article guides you through the steps on how to collect these logs. How do I collect dumpstate logs on a wearable device? The easiest way to get these logs from a Samsung wearable device is to use the SysDump tool: 1. Ensure the wearable device is connected to a mobile device via the Galaxy wearable app. 2. On the wearable device, open the device settings. 3. Tap About watch. 4. Scroll down to Serial Number and tap on it five times. 5. On the number pad that appears, enter \*#9900#. 6. Tap Run LOG_DUMP. 7. Once log collection is complete, tap Extract LOG_DUMP. Connect the mobile device to on a Windows PC via USB cable. On the PC: 1. Navigate to the device's internal storage > Pictures > Watch folder. 2. Copy the ZIP file named "log_dump_". You can then send the ZIP file containing the dumpstate logs to Samsung Support. Additional information For steps on how to collect logs on Samsung mobile devices, see How do I capture logs to troubleshoot my mobile device?

sections.title: Can I use DeX mode if certain USB functions are disabled by Knox Configure?
sections.content: Can I use DeX mode if certain USB functions are disabled by Knox Configure?. Depending on the DeX features your deployment requires, certain USB classes can't be disabled. For example, USB host storage must be enabled to use DeX mode. However, you can use DeX mode if other USB capabilities like MTP are disabled. The following are a few common situations you might encounter, and their resolutions: #Use ONLY display port via DeX display port: Enable USB host storage, Don't disable any USB peripherals #Use ONLY USB keyboard and mouse via DeX USB port: Enable USB host storage, Don't disable Human interface device #Use ONLY Ethernet via DeX ethernet port: Enable USB host storage, Don't disable Vendor specific, CDC data, Communications For more about USB restrictions, see USB device restrictions in the Knox Configure admin guide.

sections.title: Device enrolled in Knox Configure not booting correctly
sections.content: Device enrolled in Knox Configure not booting correctly. Some customers are reporting that their Knox Configure (KC)-enrolled device is either not booting, or booting in safe mode. Cause This boot issue typically occurs because critical system apps are blocklisted in your KC profile. These apps are required for the device to function correctly. A common cause is including the package com.android.settings in your blocklist. If you want to restrict Settings access for your users, see Restrictions > Prevent end users from accessing the settings menu in the KC admin guide for the proper steps. Resolution Please check your specified blocklist in the profile the device is enrolled in. For steps on how to do this, see Applications & content in the KC admin guide. If you identify that a system app is causing the issue, please remove the package from the blocklist and factory reset any affected devices to apply the change.

sections.title: Cannot push profile to a device with "Profile assigned" status in Knox Configure
sections.content: Cannot push profile to a device with "Profile assigned" status in Knox Configure. If you assign a Knox Configure (KC) profile to a device after it has completed device setup, enrollment does not automatically start. This article guides you through a few ways to manually trigger KC enrollment, for both first-time enrollment and devices that were previously enrolled in KC. First-time enrollment For devices enrolling in KC for the first time: 1. On the device, launch your internet browser of choice. 2. Navigate to http://configure.samsungknox.com. 3. Tap FIRST-TIME ENROLLMENT. 4. Factory reset the device. After the device is factory reset, ensure that you connect to a network during the setup process. KC enrollment automatically begins after setup is complete. From the Knox Configure console If your device was previously enrolled in KC: 1. Connect your device to a network. 2. Navigate to the device settings > About Device > Software Info > Knox Configure > Apply latest profile. After selecting Apply latest profile, KC enrollment triggers.

sections.title: Profile and device country do not match in Knox Configure
sections.content: Profile and device country do not match in Knox Configure. You may encounter an error during Knox Configure (KC) enrollment where the profile and device countries do not match. Cause Currently, there are two Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) servers globally in the US and EU, as well as three KC servers globally in the US, EU and China. One server is dedicated to devices in the Americas, while the second server is for devices in the EU and the rest of the world. The servers are hosted through Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the US (for North/Central/South America and the Caribbean), and in Ireland (for all countries except for China and the Americas). Based on the country you select during Samsung Knox registration, your KME/KC Admin account is linked to the appropriate server. For example, if you selected US as your country during KC/KME registration, then only devices from the Americas can be enrolled through this account. Resolution To enroll EU or other global devices, you must create a second KC/KME admin account at SamsungKnox.com and select the corresponding country. You must have two licenses to enroll devices in both US and EU consoles.

sections.title: Cannot download Galaxy Themes on Knox Configure device
sections.content: Cannot download Galaxy Themes on Knox Configure device. You may encounter an issue where you cannot download Galaxy Themes on your device managed in Knox Configure (KC), even if you have added the Galaxy Themes app to your allowlist. Cause If you allow an app in KC, all other apps are automatically blocked. In the Galaxy Themes app, each wallpaper has its own package name. Resolution Allow the wallpaper package name for each theme you want to install.

sections.title: How to set a custom icon for a browser bookmark using Knox Configure
sections.content: How to set a custom icon for a browser bookmark using Knox Configure. This article guides you through the steps on how to set a custom icon for a browser bookmark in Knox Configure (KC), to be displayed on your device's home screen. How do I set a custom icon for a browser bookmark using Knox Configure? To do this, you must have already added web bookmark(s) to the KC profile. You can add web bookmark(s) by navigating to Profile > Application & Content > Samsung Internet Browser Settings > Add web bookmarks. Once a web bookmark has been added, navigate to Profile > Home & Lock screen > Device screen preview. Once you click on a "+" icon on the device screen grid, select "Bookmark" as the Type and you will then be able to add an icon for the bookmark. Additional information For more information, please see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: Device shows battery life over 85% with Knox Configure's "Extend battery life" policy applied
sections.content: Device shows battery life over 85% with Knox Configure's "Extend battery life" policy applied. On a Knox Configure (KC)-managed device with the Extend battery life by limiting the maximum charge when connected to a power source policy enabled, you may notice that the device still charges to 100% despite the policy setting the maximum charge level to 85%. Cause Extend battery life by limiting the maximum charge when connected to a power source protects your battery by preventing the LDU terminal from swelling when constantly plugged in to a power source. With this policy, the charging voltage level is lowered from 4.4V to 4.2V. As the terminal recognizes that the device is fully charged, even though the voltage level was lowered, the battery percentage still shows as 100% when it reaches the 85% charge limit. How can I check if the Extend battery life policy is successfully applied on a device? After applying a KC profile with Extend battery life by limiting the maximum charge when connected to a power source enabled, you can check the Protect battery setting on your device. To do so, go to Settings > Device care > Battery > Charging > Protect battery.

sections.title: An error occurred with setSealedHomeActivity: applicationPackageName in your profile
sections.content: An error occurred with setSealedHomeActivity: applicationPackageName in your profile. The device logs in your KC console specifies the error message: `Error 51010: An error occurred with setSealedHomeActivity: applicationPackageName in your profile. Check the configuration items in your profile and retry.` Cause A Google Play app cannot be assigned as the ProKiosk home activity, as it cannot be installed before the home activity is launched. Resolution Set the KC ProKiosk home activity to one of the following: An APK file uploaded to KC and added to the ProKiosk profile, A pre-installed device app Additional information For more information about Kiosk mode, please see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: How to disable Google Voice Assistant with Knox Configure
sections.content: How to disable Google Voice Assistant with Knox Configure. The Google voice assistant is included in 2 applications: 1. Google voice assistant 2. Google quick search To completely remove Google voice assistant from activating on your device, you will need to disable both packages. See below for the complete steps. If the Google quick search is not disabled, the device user will be able use the Google voice assistant by long pressing the home button and activating the Google quick search. Resolution 1. Navigate to your KC console and select or create a new profile. 2. On the Applications & content page, under Disable the usage of other applications, add the following packages: com.google.android.apps.googleassistant , com.google.android.googlequicksearchbox Additional information To learn more about KC profile features, please see the KC guide.

sections.title: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu and com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung
sections.content: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu and com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung. Some administrators are encountering a 51010 error if they apply the following KC feature, Installation allowlist and enrolling the device in KM. The device logs in your KC console specifies the error message: `Error 51010: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu in your profile. Check the configuration items in your profile and retry.` `Error 51010: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung in your profile. Check the configuration items in your profile and retry.` Cause The application package names are not specified in the installation allowlist for: Knox Service Plugin, Samsung Knox Manage When applying the installation allowlist in Knox Configure, it automatically blocks all installation attempts from apps that are not included on the whitelist. Resolution To solve the problem, add the following package name under installation allowlist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu, com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung Push the updated profile to the devices and try the enrollment again.

sections.title: How to use the Activate Knox License Feature
sections.content: How to use the Activate Knox License Feature. This KBA will go over how to use the Activate Knox License feature in KC when uploading your own application. How do I add an application to KC and add a license key to be activated for the app upon enrollment? The steps below can also be performed when creating a profile in the Applications and widgets step. 1. In the KC console, navigate to the Library page from the left hand side panel. For _KC China_ users this page is called Applications. 2. Under the Mobile Apps tab, select Add Mobile application. 3. Select Upload Application. 4. Select Browse and choose the APK you want to upload. 5. Select the checkbox Activate Knox license. 6. If you haven't added a valid license key (see the below section for more information about valid license keys) to the license page of KC yet, select Add a new license. Otherwise, just choose your key from the dropdown menu. 7. Once done, select Upload to save. 8. In the library page, you should see the application you uploaded. In the corner of that application, there is a License tag. Applications uploaded without using the Activate Knox license will not have this tag. If you have uploaded an application without adding a license but wish to add a license, you will need to delete the application and re-upload the package following steps 1-7. 9. If you click on your application, you can see details about the application and also change the license key. 10. Assign a device to a KC profile that includes this newly added application. 11. During enrollment, in the "downloading apps" process, you should see a toast message that reads "Knox license validation completed successfully." Valid License Keys As noted in the tooltip of this feature, only custom SDK license SKUs are supported. Custom SDK licenses have been deprecated, but if you still have a valid custom SDK license, you can still utilize this feature. See more about Knox SDK Licenses. 4004 error When adding a license key to the Activate Knox license section, some users have reported getting a 4004 error. This error indicates that you have not entered a valid license key. See the above section for what license keys are accepted in this feature. If you have entered a valid license key but continue to experience this issue, please submit a support ticket through your Knox dashboard and specify the license key in question. 30102 error During the enrollment process, some users have reported getting a 30102 error and seeing the toast message: "Failed to validate product key" This error indicates that you have not properly associated your app with the license key in KPP. If you have properly bound your app to your license key in KPP but continue to experience this issue, please submit a support ticket through your Knox dashboard. Please specify the license key and application package name in question.

sections.title: How can I prevent a wearable device from accessing a network connection through companion mode?
sections.content: How can I prevent a wearable device from accessing a network connection through companion mode?. Companion mode overrides the watch's Wi-Fi configurations and always on policies set by the IT admin, since it automatically follows the mobile device's access point (AP) and network connection settings. To ensure that the wearable device maintains its Wi-Fi configurations and always on policies, disable Bluetooth to block companion mode.

sections.title: My customer doesn't have a Knox Configure Customer ID. Can I submit their device information?
sections.content: My customer doesn't have a Knox Configure Customer ID. Can I submit their device information?. Before you can register their devices, the customer must first sign up for Knox Configure or Knox Mobile Enrollment first, and then share their Knox Customer ID with you. To learn how to sign up, see Sign up for Knox Configure.

sections.title: How do I fix "signing failed" errors?
sections.content: How do I fix "signing failed" errors?. There are many common causes for "signing failed" error messages, including: Using an undefined privilege, Broken files, Using an accessory protocol, Using an SDK default key. Doing so can result in a "signing failed" error message. A Samsung certificate registered to the Knox Configure portal must be used to sign the app. For more details, see Getting Certificates in the Galaxy Watch for Tizen documentation. See Device-side errors for additional details on error codes and error messages.

sections.title: The WKC agent doesn't automatically update my wearable device after a push update
sections.content: The WKC agent doesn't automatically update my wearable device after a push update. Sometimes, the WKC agent doesn't automatically update the wearable device when a push update is sent. This can occur when a failing app is assigned to the profile. Resolution To troubleshoot this issue, begin by viewing the device log for error details: 1. Go to Devices, then open the DEVICES tab. 2. Check the status of the target device to identify if the device failed to receive the push update. 3. Select the target device. 4. Click ACTION > View device log to identify the app or setting that may have caused the error. Refer to the Knox Configure for Wearables Admin guide for additional guidance on configuration errors. Once you've identified the app or setting that caused the error: 1. Go to Devices, then open the DEVICES tab. 2. Click the target device's assigned profile. From the Profile configuration dashboard: 1. Click APPLICATIONS or DEVICE SETTINGS to remove any settings or app from the profile which may have triggered the failure to update. 2. Update the profile with a valid app. 3. Push the update again. Additional information , Device states in the Knox Configure for Wearables Admin guide, Troubleshooting device-side configuration errors in the Knox Configure for Wearables Admin guide

sections.title: If a KC license expires and is then reactivated, the assigned and activated seats displayed within the KC console are not accurate
sections.content: If a KC license expires and is then reactivated, the assigned and activated seats displayed within the KC console are not accurate. When a license expires, devices are automatically unassigned from their profiles. If a customer renews the license, the "Assigned Seats" and "Activated Seats" numbers are not updated, so the seat numbers prior to license expiration are shown. If the allotted seat count was previously used up, the customer will be unable to assign devices back to the license. Cause The KC database and license database license counts are out of sync. Resolution The KC backend team is currently working on a fix for this issue. Customer action Please raise a ticket in Salesforce from within your Samsung Knox dashboard. To ensure your issue is promptly processed, include the following with your information: Title: Renewed KC license seat count issue Description: KC Customer ID: License Key:

sections.title: Screen timeout set in Knox Configure is not shown in device settings
sections.content: Screen timeout set in Knox Configure is not shown in device settings. If a device user attempts to set the screen timeout setting using the Settings > Display > Screen timeout console navigation path, the maximum length of time selectable is either 10 minutes or 30 minutes, depending on whether the device has an AMOLED or non-AMOLED display. Using KC, administrators can set the device screen timeout to a value greater than 10 minutes. Even if the timeout setting is applied successfully, when the device is restarted and the user navigates to Settings > Display > Screen timeout, the maximum screen timeout is displayed instead. Cause The screen timeout value has actually been applied successfully, but the console's Settings menu limits the length of time before a device screen turns off. For AMOLED displays, the maximum screen timeout is 600 seconds. For non-AMOLED displays, the maximum screen timeout is 1800 seconds. However, a KC administrator can override this UI limitation and set the screen timeout to any value between 5 to 1000 seconds. If this value exceeds the limit as defined above, the UI will display the maximum screen timeout value instead. Resolution This is expected behavior. The device screen will time out based on the value set in KC, not the maximum screen timeout of either 10 or 30 minutes displayed on the device. Additional Information For additional information on how the screen timeout is handled, refer to the Knox SDK documentation).

sections.title: How to change configured devices to a different license key in Knox Configure
sections.content: How to change configured devices to a different license key in Knox Configure. Overview This article guides you through the steps on how to switch a KC-configured device to a different license (e.g. a trial license) without unassigning the device. If the old license is about to expire, these steps must be performed before the license expiry date. When a KC"license (trial or commercial) expires, there is a 30 day grace period to accommodate license renewal delays, after which any devices associated with the license are automatically unassigned from the profile"they were configured to. If the same license key is renewed, there is no action required and you can continue to use the key as normal. You may also replace it with a new key within 30 days to avoid KC unassigning your devices. If a device is no longer in the "configured" state, KC cannot push profile updates or any other changes to the device. The device must manually trigger KC for any profile changes to be applied. There are three ways to do this: 1. From a browser on the device, navigate to configure.samsungknox.com, then select Re-enroll. 2. Navigate to the device settings > About Device > Software Info > Knox Configure > Apply latest profile. 3. Factory reset the device. If a device is automatically unassigned from KC, it remains configured to the profile unless the device user performs any of the 3 actions above. If the device is in the "Unassigned" state when the device user performs one of the 3 actions, then the device will be unconfigured. How do I change all my configured devices to a different license? Follow the steps below if you are: Switching all devices from a trial license to a commercial license, Switching all devices from a commercial license to a different commercial license 1. ​In the KC console, under Licenses, select the old license you wish to replace. 2. Select the Actions dropdown and select Replace License. 3. Select the new license as instructed on the following page, then"click Done. All devices previously assigned to the old license are now assigned to the new license key. How do I change only a select few devices to a different license? Follow the steps below if you are switching one device to a different license key: 1. In the KC console, under Licenses > Enter license key, add the new license key to the license tab. 2. Select the profile name you would like the devices to be configured to. If you are configuring the device to the same profile it is already configured to, you will need to clone the profile. Currently, it is not possible to change licenses within the same profile. To clone a profile, navigate to Profiles > Select the checkbox beside the profile name you would like to clone > Actions > Clone to edit. 3. Under Devices > select the Device ID of the device you wish to edit. 4. In the device details panel, select Edit. 5. In the Profile dropdown, either select the cloned profile created in Step 2 or a new profile you wish to apply to the device. 6. In the License dropdown, select the new license you wish to switch to. 7. Click Save. If you use this method, the device user is required to accept and apply the latest profile once the changes have been saved. They may also choose to postpone the update. If you want to push the update without user consent, please see the steps below. Follow the steps below if you are switching one or multiple devices to a different license key: 1. In the KC console, under Licenses > Enter license key, add the new license key to the license tab. 2. Select the profile name you would like the devices to be configured to. If you are configuring the device to the same profile it is already configured to, you will need to clone the profile. Currently, it is not possible to change licenses within the same profile. To clone a profile, navigate to Profiles > Select the checkbox beside the profile name you would like to clone > Actions > Clone to edit. 3. Select the devices tile > Actions > Assign devices. 4. Select the devices you want to assign. If you cannot find the device, ensure you are not filtering the devices by status. To clear the filter, select Status > Clear status. 5. Select Assign once all the devices you want to assign are selected. 6. Select No when a pop-up appears asking if you want to continue using the existing license. If you would like the devices to automatically receive the changes you are making, select Push update without requesting end-user consent. 7. Select the new license that you would like the devices to use, then click Submit. How do I renew my Knox Configure commercial license? To renew your KC commercial license, contact your KC license reseller. As a best practice, we recommend that you renew your commercial license instead of requesting a new one. If you renew your license, you can continue to use the same one, avoiding the steps associated with switching to a new license.

sections.title: If a trial license expires before it's upgraded, how can I apply a commercial license?
sections.content: If a trial license expires before it's upgraded, how can I apply a commercial license?. If a trial license has expired, you must assign devices with a new valid license. After you assign devices in the Knox Configure console, on the device the user must go to Settings > About phone > Software info > Knox Configure > Apply latest profile to trigger re-enrollment in Knox Configure. Additionally, devices can be re-enrolled after a factory reset or at configure.samsungknox.com.

sections.title: Knox Configure compatibility with Samsung devices
sections.content: Knox Configure compatibility with Samsung devices. Full KC features are supported on Secured by Knox devices, while few features are not available for Android, Others devices. The following KC features are unavailable for Android, Others devices: Auto power on, Disable camera, Disable USB class, Disable OMC mode, APN settings, SIM lock PIN, Kiosk mode, Device lock, Wi-Fi credential provisioning, Shared device, Enterprise billing, KDA enrollment, Factory Reset Protection bypass To see the Android, Others device list, visit Devices Secured by Knox. How do I set up my Android, Others device in Knox Configure? If Knox is incompatible with your device, when creating your KC profile, ensure that you have selected Other Samsung devices under General information > Device level.

sections.title: Unable to change app icon of custom app
sections.content: Unable to change app icon of custom app. In KC, when an administrator tries to change a custom app's icon in a profile that was set by a different administrator, the icon is not changed. The following error is shown in the device logs: ``` 11-22 11:30:44.302 1000 1213 7317 D ApplicationPolicy: changeApplicationIcon:packageName com.samsung.android.messagingcalled from :10167 11-22 11:30:44.304 1000 1213 7317 E ApplicationIconDb: updateApplicationIcon(): invalid ownerUid ``` Cause In KC, an icon set by one administrator cannot be changed by a second administrator. This behavior is by API design. Resolution To change the app icon, please ensure that the original administrator who set the"app icon makes the update in the KC profile. Alternatively, Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) allows a KC super admin"to assign specific permissions to individual admins. For instructions on how to configure admin permissions, see Administrators and roles. Additional information For more information on how KC changes app icons, see the Knox API documentation).

sections.title: Cannot set background image (Failed to configure | 51010)
sections.content: Cannot set background image (Failed to configure , 51010). Some administrators are reporting that they are"unable to set a background wallpaper on a device in KC, as the following error message appears: Failed to configure , 51010 Error 51010: An error occurred with setWallPaper in your profile. Check the configuration items in your profile and retry. Cause There"is a device administrator application that is restricting the wallpaper change, even if the feature is enabled in KC. As device administrator applications include device management solutions,"if the device is enrolled in two management solutions, the most restrictive"configured policy"applies. Resolution If the device is also enrolled in more than one management solution, check the restrictions in each solution"profile. Please ensure that in one solution, the"policy"that enables"wallpaper changing"is"not restricted. In any additional solutions, the wallpaper change policy should"be set as unconfigured. For example, if the device is enrolled in Knox Manage (KM) and KC, set the policies in KM and KC as shown below: KM: Change wallpaper: N/A, KC: Prevent end users from changing the Home screen and Lock screen wallpapers: Enabled After ensuring that the policies are updated, try changing the device's wallpaper in KC again.

sections.title: Device not found when performing bulk actions in Knox Configure
sections.content: Device not found when performing bulk actions in Knox Configure. In KC, when uploading a CSV file containing device IDs in BULK ACTIONS, the following error is returned: Device not found Cause Your CSV file may be encrypted, preventing KC from reading the device IDs correctly. Resolution 1. In KC, select BULK ACTIONS. 2. Download the CSV file template. 3. In the template, enter the device IDs in the CSV file and save your changes. 4. In BULK ACTIONS, upload your new CSV file. Ensure no extra characters (e.g. ENTER or SPACE) are included in your CSV file. Additional information To learn more about bulk actions in KC, see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: Launch immediately on every boot-up feature is delayed in Knox Configure
sections.content: Launch immediately on every boot-up feature is delayed in Knox Configure. Knox Configure (KC) supports a feature that allows a specified application to be launched immediately when a device is booted. You can configure the Launch immediately on every boot-up feature in the Applications & content section of your KC profile. After the Samsung launcher loads, you may experience a 30-second"delay"before the"application launches. Cause This is expected behavior. After the device boots, the KC client must receive the boot message to launch, in addition to the time required to launch the application. This causes"a short launch delay"after boot-up. Workaround If your application must be launched immediately, you may use a KC profile configured in Prokiosk mode with the application set as the Prokiosk mode home activity. Additional information For steps on how to configure a profile in ProKiosk mode, see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: How to factory reset a device managed in Knox Configure
sections.content: How to factory reset a device managed in Knox Configure. This knowledge base article guides you through the steps on how to factory reset a device managed by Knox Configure (KC). How do I factory reset"my device from its settings? To trigger a factory reset from your device: 1. On the device, navigate to Settings > General management > Reset > Factory data reset. 2. Select Reset. If your device is configured to a profile with "Disable factory reset" enabled,"or if it is enrolled in another UEM that prevents factory reset, you cannot"reset from your device's Settings menu. How do I factory reset my device from Knox Configure? If you cannot access the settings menu on your device, you can reset it from the KC console. Ensure that your device is: In the Configured state, Connected to a network If the device is not connected to a network, the factory reset command is queued until the device can receive"the message. To factory reset your device from KC: 1. In your KC console,"in the left navigation bar, select Devices > Devices. 2. Select the Device ID of the device you want to factory reset. 3. Select Actions > Reboot or factory reset device(s ). 4. In the pop-up that appears, select Factory reset device(s). 5. Click Confirm. If your device is configured to a profile with "Disable factory reset" enabled, you will still be able to factory reset your devices using this method."However, if your device is enrolled in a third-party application (i.e. UEM) that prevents factory reset,"reset functionality may vary in"the KC console. Additional information If you are unable to use the methods described here, you can also hard reset the device using the hardware keys. As these steps vary depending on your device, consult your carrier's documentation for hard reset instructions. If you have any restrictions placed on your device by KC or a UEM, you cannot reset your device with its hardware keys.

sections.title: How to prevent Knox Configure client app from"copying"to"new device during data transfer
sections.content: How to prevent Knox Configure client app from"copying"to"new device during data transfer. When transferring data from a device that was previously enrolled in Knox Configure (KC)"to a new device using Samsung Switch, you may want to prevent the KC client application from being copied to the new device. How do I prevent the Knox Configure client app from being transferred to my new device? By Samsung Switch design, the KC client is included in the data backup and"transfer between devices. Instead, you can use Samsung Cloud to sync your call logs, messages, apps, and other device data"to a new device without"the KC Client. To transfer your device data using Samsung Cloud: 1. On the old device, go to Settings > Accounts and backup > Samsung Cloud. 2. Sign in to your Samsung Account. 3. Select Back up this phone >"Back up. Additional information For an overview of Samsung Cloud and its features, visit the Samsung Cloud support page.

sections.title: Device connected to"power source"constantly reboots when "Power on the device when connected to a power source" is enabled in Knox Configure
sections.content: Device connected to"power source"constantly reboots when "Power on the device when connected to a power source" is enabled in Knox Configure. Some devices configured to a Knox Configure (KC)"profile with"the "Power on the device when connected to a power source" and""Auto power on/off" features enabled are"continuously powering"off and on"upon connecting"to a power source. Cause The device's battery is fully depleted. This can happen if the device was left on until its battery drained,"and"not connected to a power source for an extended period of time. When enabled, KC's "Power on the device when connected to a power source" feature automatically boots a device upon connecting to a power source. If its battery depletes faster than it can charge, the device may"turn off and reboot in a loop. Resolution Bring the"affected devices to your nearest Samsung service center for repair. Additional information To learn more about the "Power on the device when connected to a power source" feature, see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: How to set"custom launcher app with navigation bar in Knox Configure
sections.content: How to set"custom launcher app with navigation bar in Knox Configure. This knowledge base article guides you through"the steps on how to set up a custom launcher in Knox Configure (KC) without Kiosk mode, which maintains the"Samsung Settings app and navigation bar functionality. If you set a custom launcher application"in Kiosk mode, the Samsung Settings app and navigation bar are disabled. How do I set"a custom launcher with the navigation bar"using Knox Configure? Ensure you perform the steps below correctly, or"your"device may"enter a boot loop. Prerequisite: The custom launcher you select"must be a launcher application. To specify an application as a launcher, include"the following text in its manifest.xml file. `` In KC, to set"a custom launcher on your device with the Settings app and navigation bar: 1. In your"KC console, under Profiles, select the profile or create a profile. 2. At the Select apps and widgets page select the custom launcher application. 3. Under Applications & content > Disable the usage of other applications, enter `com.sec.android.app.launcher`. 4. Click Save and assign your devices to the profile. Your device can now use a custom launcher without Kiosk mode. How do I recover a device that is boot looping from a launcher error? If your device is boot looping due to an error in the above steps: 1. Follow the steps in the KC admin guide to perform a factory reset. 2. In the KC profile, make any"necessary changes to the configuration. 3. Push your profile changes to the device. Alternatively, you may unassign the device"from KC to resolve the issue.

sections.title: Initial booting animation does not change after custom boot animation is set in Knox Configure
sections.content: Initial booting animation does not change after custom boot animation is set in Knox Configure. After setting a custom booting animation in Knox Configure (KC), the initial booting animation displaying "Samsung" and the device's model name still appears before the custom animation. Cause This is expected behavior. Even if a custom boot animation is selected in KC, a device-specific screen always appears first. Resolution Due to Google's policy, the device-specific boot screen cannot be replaced.

sections.title: Custom booting animation and sound file set in Knox Configure are unsynchronized
sections.content: Custom booting animation and sound file set in Knox Configure are unsynchronized. When setting a custom booting animation in Knox Configure (KC), the booting animation and sound file are unsynchronized. The animation begins before the sound file. Cause There is a"flag in the device framework that is disabled by default on consumer devices, causing the asynchronous boot animation. Resolution This is expected behaviour in the default system boot-up logic, and cannot be changed. Workaround You can manually synchronize the animation and sound files by adding blank images"in the frames before the custom images, imitating"the black screen shown during the startup process. The blank images delay"the"animation so it begins with the sound file. Additional information For steps on how to create a custom booting animation, see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: How to submit a device animation request
sections.content: How to submit a device animation request. Some IT administrators report that they are unable to create a device animation request through the KC China Console. Cause The CREATE A DEVICE ANIMATION REQUEST button directs the customer to create an animation request from Samsung Enterprise Alliance Program (SEAP) which is not supported by KC China. Resolution The KC team is working on a separate workflow to submit an animation request. Please check back for updates on the release. Workaround Please send the source images to srcb.tam@samsung.com. Samsung will convert the png images into qmg files and provide them to you. Please ensure that the images provided follow the guidelines below: Resolution: Same as the device resolution (e.g. 1440 x 2560 for Galaxy S7). File format: PNG, File naming: e.g. boot01.png, boot02.png, boot03.png, and so on: Note that only lowercase letters and numbers are allowed. Ensure to start with "01" and increase the number one by one in order. Quantity limit: boot.qmg: Up to 99 png files. bootloop.qmg: Up to 99 png files. shutdown.qmg: Up to 30 png files. Size limit: Each png file should be under 2MB. The total size of png files per each qmg should be under 30MB.

sections.title: Can I add IP addresses to the URL blocklist in my Knox Configure profile?
sections.content: Can I add IP addresses to the URL blocklist in my Knox Configure profile?. Currently, Knox Configure can only block URLs, and not IP addresses. You can enter an IP address without causing an error, but it won't be blocked. If you need to block IP addresses, please see the Knox SDK guide for more options. The addRules()) operation can be used to block certain IPs.

sections.title: Information about using Enterprise Edition devices with Knox Configure
sections.content: Information about using Enterprise Edition devices with Knox Configure. The following will outline some general information about using Enterprise Edition devices with Knox Configure. How do I upload and configure a profile to an Enterprise Edition device in Knox Configure? Uploading and assigning EE devices in Knox Configure works the same as non-EE devices. One distinguishing detail is that when an EE device is uploaded, it will automatically have an Enterprise Edition tag appended to them. Licensing , Starting June 17th, 2021, EE devices no longer require a EE-specific license key for Knox Configure. They can now be assigned a regular Knox Configure license. Starting August 1st, 2021, EE Licenses will no longer be able to be generated in samsungknox.com EE devices no longer require a Knox Configure EE license key. Assigning an EE device will work the same as non-EE devices and can use the same licenses. If you still have a Knox Configure EE legacy license key, EE devices released before August 1st, 2021 can still be assigned the EE legacy license key. EE devices released after August 1st, 2021 cannot be assigned an EE legacy license key. See more information about license key management in Knox Configure here. If you encounter an error with assigning an EE device, please submit a support ticket from your Knox User Dashboard. Ensure you include the information below: _The Knox customer ID of the account_ _The error message_ _Any license specific information related to the issue_ Tags to organize Enterprise Edition devices To determine whether a device model is eligible for EE, you can now check to see if it has an Eligible for Enterprise Edition tag. On the Device Details panel, devices are now auto-tagged to differentiate between old and new EE devices. Old EE devices are tagged with Enterprise Edition and 1 more. When you hover over the 1 more tag, it displays Eligible for Enterprise Edition. New EE devices are only tagged with Enterprise Edition. The EE tags are displayed first, followed by other tags in alphabetical order.

sections.title: Uploading an application to KC fails with a 400003 error
sections.content: Uploading an application to KC fails with a 400003 error. IT administrators are reporting that some applications are failing to be uploaded to the KC China portal. You may be presented with the following error: ``` The application is invalid: the manifest XML is missing. [400003] ``` Cause KC China is unable to detect the manifest file of the APK. Resolution The KC China team is currently working on a fix. Please check back for updates on the release. Workaround Add the APK file to devices in the KC profile under Applications & content > Content instead. The end user will need to install the APK file manually by accessing the content folder once the device has been configured to the KC profile.

sections.title: Unable to invite a new administrator to Knox Configure China
sections.content: Unable to invite a new administrator to Knox Configure China. There are 2 common errors that can cause IT admins to be unable to invite a new administrator to their KC console: 1. The new administrator being invited has already been invited before. 2. The new administrator invited does not receive the invitation email sent by the Knox system, but there was no error message indicating the invitation was not successful in the KC China portal after selecting INVITE. Cause To resolve issue #1, please follow the resolution outlined in the linked article above. For issue #2, it is most likely that the invitation email was rejected as spam by the receiving email server. Resolution IT admins should check email filters to ensure they can receive the verification email. If the new admin is still unable to receive the invitation email due to their filter, users can complete the invitation process by applying for a KC account (https://www.samsungknox.cn). When applying, the application will be automatically approved and associated with the primary KC account of the company that had invited them. Please ensure the administrator you are inviting is using a business email address. Personal email addresses such as @139.com, @163.com, etc, that use 3rd party email receiving servers can often reject emails coming from Samsung servers. This only applies to the KC China region. Please do not follow this resolution if you are being invited to KC in the US or EU region. Follow this article if you are not properly receiving the verification email in these regions instead. Additional Information To request access to Knox Configure China, please refer to the article How to sign up for Knox Configure China.

sections.title: How to restrict a user from sharing device data with Knox Configure
sections.content: How to restrict a user from sharing device data with Knox Configure. This article provides information on basic policies to set in KC in order to restrict a user from sharing device data. How can I restrict the access and sharing of device data? Below is a list of policies available in KC to restrict a user from sharing device data. 1. In the KC console, under Profiles, select Create profile. 2. On the Device Connectivity page, ensure you: Select Disable Bluetooth , Select Disable NFC , Under USB Connection > Set default USB connection type to Charging 3. On the Device Settings page: Under Hide Settings menu/elements, select Bluetooth and Developer , Under Developer settings, select Disable USB debugging mode , Under Security, select Disable SD Card Access 4. On the Restrictions page: Under DEVICE FUNCTIONALITY: Select Prevent end-users capturing the screen , Select Prevent end-users from sending SMS , Select Prevent end-users from sending MMS , Under USB DEVICE RESTRICTIONS: Select Disable USB Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) This is not an exhaustive list of policies to block all existing sharing methods. Additional information To learn more about the policies available, please refer to the Knox Configure Guide.

sections.title: How to sign up for Knox Configure China
sections.content: How to sign up for Knox Configure China. The KC China server is independent from the KC global server. Therefore, the access web address and account application process differ from the steps outlined in the global KC guide. Please follow the steps below to begin using the KC China service. Step 1. Access Knox Configure China Portal and apply for a Knox account 1. Navigate to Samsung Knox China. 2. Click Register to apply for a Knox account. 3. Enter your work email to register for a Knox Account. Please do not use a personal email address. 4. If you already have a Samsung Account linked with the email address entered above, then Sign in and skip to Step 3. If you do not have a Samsung Account, follow the steps outlined in Step 2. Step 2. Apply for a Samsung Account 1. Click Create account or apply for a Samsung Account here. 2. Agree to the listed terms and conditions for account creation. 3. Fill out the required fields and select Next to complete the Knox Portal registration process. 4. Complete the SMS Verification. 5. Once submitted, an email is sent to the email address provided with a PIN code for account activation. 6. Complete the Samsung Account application. Step 3. Request access to Knox Configure Now that you have successfully obtained a Samsung Knox Portal account, you can request access to Knox Configure. 1. You will be directed to this page to fill out the required fields. Click next to continue. 2. Access the Knox Configure China dashboard. 3. Click Apply now to apply for Knox Configure. 4. Accept the terms and conditions of Knox Configure China. 5. The Knox Configure China team will review your request. Once your request is verified, you will receive a confirmation email and be able to access the Knox Configure console. This process typically takes 2-3 business days.

sections.title: Custom watchface is not applied after a software update
sections.content: Custom watchface is not applied after a software update. After a software update, the custom watchface applied in Knox Configure is not applied on the device. Cause This is expected behaviour. After a software update, the framework is cleared. Resolution After a software update, perform one of the methods below to restore the custom watchface: Go to the device's Settings, then select About Device > Software Info > Knox Configure > Apply latest profile. From the Knox Configure console, perform a profile push to the device. See Updating an existing device profile > push an update. Factory reset the device and re-enroll the device in Knox Configure. Block software updates.

sections.title: Cannot set home and lock screen for foldable devices in Knox Configure
sections.content: Cannot set home and lock screen for foldable devices in Knox Configure. When using KC to change the default home screen and lock screen wallpaper of a foldable device, only the Main Screen's wallpaper is changed, but the Cover Screen's home screen and lock screen wallpaper do not change. Cause This is expected behavior. KC can only set the Main Screen's wallpaper.

sections.title: How to set the MAC address as Phone MAC in Knox Configure
sections.content: How to set the MAC address as Phone MAC in Knox Configure. On Android 10 devices and higher, Wi-Fi settings can be configured to have the MAC address as Randomized MAC or Phone MAC. The default value is Randomized MAC. This article guides you on how to use KC to configure devices on the allowlist using a phone MAC address. Before you configure the MAC address, select Knox version 3.4 or above in your KC profile. For more details, refer to Provide profile information. How do I set the MAC address as a phone MAC? To set the MAC address type: 1. On the KC console, go to Profiles and select the profile to update. 2. Click Device connectivity > Edit. 3. Enter the SSID Name and select the SSID security type from the Security drop-down. 4. For MAC address type, select Phone MAC. 5. Click Save. You must repeat the steps for every Wi-Fi network that restricts access based on MAC addresses. Additional information To learn how to create a Knox Configure profile, refer to Create a profile.

sections.title: Renew and change Knox Configure licenses
sections.content: Renew and change Knox Configure licenses. When a trial or commercial Knox Configure license expires, there is a 30-day grace period to accommodate license renewal delays. After this period, any devices associated with the license are automatically unassigned from the profile they were configured to, and you won't be able to push profile updates, send lock and unlock commands, reboot, or factory reset your devices. Any previously scheduled pushes will also fail. If the same license is renewed, you don't need to take further action. You can also choose to replace your current license with a new one, but be sure to do so within 30 days to avoid your devices being unassigned. For more details about replacing an existing license, see License management in the Knox Configure admin guide. Who to contact to renew licenses To renew your commercial license, contact your Knox Configure license reseller. As a best practice, we recommend you renew your commercial license instead of requesting a new one. If you renew your license, you can avoid potential workflow disruptions caused by switching to a new license. What if I want to change the number of license assignments? If you want to increase the number of assignments on your existing license, you can contact your reseller to renew the license with additional assignments. If you want to decrease the number of assignments on the license, you'll need to request a new license instead. If the number of licenses assigned is higher than the number of assignments available on the renewed license, you won't be able to choose which devices are activated with the renewal. For example, say you had a license that had 20 assignments, and you assigned it to 20 devices. When it expired, you only renewed 15 assignments for the license. Knox Configure automatically selects 15 of the 20 devices previously activated on the license to activate on the new license. The other devices are then considered expired. If the expired devices aren't moved to a new license, they're unassigned after the 30-day grace period. The license details also show that the total number of assignments purchased is less than the number of activations. To prevent Knox Configure from automatically selecting devices for renewal, request a new license with the number of assignments you want, then switch the desired devices to it. Additional information , License management, How to change configured devices to a different license key in Knox Configure

sections.title: How to obtain KPE Premium licenses for Knox Configure China
sections.content: How to obtain KPE Premium licenses for Knox Configure China. This article provides information on how to obtain a KPE Premium license for Knox Configure China. As of June 8, 2022, Samsung implemented a feature which allows customers in China to obtain a KPE Premium license from the Samsung Knox dashboard. How to obtain a KPE Premium license To generate a KPE Premium license: 1. On the Knox Configure console, click SDKs > Generate new key. 2. If you agree to the User Agreement, click Accept. 3. A new KPE Premium license is generated. After you generate the license, it's available immediately without any further approval.

sections.title: How to disable backup and restore of device data
sections.content: How to disable backup and restore of device data. The two default apps that back up and restore device data on Samsung devices are Samsung Cloud and Samsung Smart Switch. Samsung Cloud allows device users to back up or restore data, while Samsung Smart Switch allows device users to restore data from another device or transfer content from an external storage drive. Device users tap Device settings > Account and backup to launch these apps on their Samsung devices. How to disable backup and restore of device data To prevent either of these apps from activating on the user's devices, follow the steps below to disable both apps: 1. On the Knox Configure console, go to Profiles. 2. Select an existing profile or create a new profile. 3. On the Applications & content page, under APPLICATION RESTRICTIONS > Disable the usage of other applications, click EDIT. Then, add the following packages: Samsung Cloud - com.osp.app.signin , Samsung Smart Switch - com.sec.android.easyMover 4. Click SAVE. The console prompts you to log your changes. 5. Optionally add a comment describing your changes, then click SAVE. Additional information To learn more about Knox Configure profiles, see Normal mode features.

sections.title: How to bulk query devices with Knox Configure China
sections.content: How to bulk query devices with Knox Configure China. This article provides information on how to bulk query devices with Knox Configure China. All devices must already exist in your Knox device inventory. You can query a maximum of 10,000 devices per upload. How to bulk query devices To bulk query devices: 1. Sign in to Knox Configure China with your Knox credentials. 2. Go to Devices. 3. Click Action > Bulk query devices. 4. Click Download CSV file template. 5. Open the CSV file in a text editor or spreadsheet app, and enter the device IDs you want to query. Device IDs can either be the device's IMEI/MEID or serial number. 6. Upload the filled CSV template, then click Submit. The console shows the status of all devices included in the CSV file that was uploaded.

sections.title: Access Denied error occurs after enrolling in Knox Configure China
sections.content: Access Denied error occurs after enrolling in Knox Configure China. With Knox Configure, you can complete the setup wizard on a device and assign it a profile. However, when accessing configure.samsungknox.cn to start enrollment after setup, the web page fails to load. Cause Although the Knox Configure China Portal has the region-appropriate cn top-level domain (www.samsungknox.cn), the enrollment service is hosted on the global samsungknox domain (configure.samsungknox.com). Resolution On your device, open a web browser and go to configure.samsungknox.com. Tap FIRST-TIME ENROLLMENT to start enrollment.

sections.title: Error 91014 --- Unable to add app to ProKiosk mode home screen
sections.content: Error 91014 --- Unable to add app to ProKiosk mode home screen. Known issue where users are unable to add app to ProKiosk mode home screen When adding an app to the ProKiosk mode home screen with the Add to Multi-App Kiosk home action, users may encounter an issue where the app fails to be added. The Knox Configure device log contains the following error: Error: Warning (91014): Unable to create kiosk shortcut(s) Cause An app must be pre-installed to be successfully added to the ProKiosk mode home screen. The app is not considered pre-installed if it meets any of the following criteria: App has been deleted from the device, App package name is invalid when adding to Add to Multi-App Kiosk home, App is from the Google Play Store and is not pre-installed Apps added to a Knox Configure profile through the Google Play Store are not considered pre-installed. After Knox Configure enrollment is complete, the device user must tap the app shortcut on the device to complete the installation from the Google Play Store. If the app is not pre-installed, then attempting to add the app to the home screen will fail. Resolution If the app is not pre-installed, the app APK must be uploaded to Knox Configure. If the APK file can't be added, users must manually install the app from the Google Play Store either before or after device enrollment. To manually install the app before enrolling the device: 1. Start the device. 2. Install the app from the Google Play Store. 3. Assign the Knox Configure profile to the device. 4. Open the device browser and go to configure.samsungknox.com. 5. Tap FIRST-TIME ENROLLMENT. 6. Complete the enrollment process. To manually install the app after enrolling the device: 1. In the Knox Configure profile, ensure the app shortcut is removed from the Multi-App Kiosk home screen. 2. Start the device and enroll it in Knox Configure. 3. Exit ProKiosk mode by holding the power button and entering the passcode set in the Knox Configure console. 4. Install the app from the Google Play Store. 5. In the Knox Configure profile, add the app to the Multi-App Kiosk home screen. 6. Push a profile update. Additional information Create a Knox Configure profile About ProKiosk mode Knox Configure device enrollment

sections.title: Uploaded content not visible in device directory
sections.content: Uploaded content not visible in device directory. Users may encounter an issue where uploaded content can't be found on the device. Learn how to resolve this issue. By default, content will upload to a Content folder inside the Download directory. After uploading content to a device, users might encounter the issue where the content isn't visible on the device and the Content directory can't be found. Attempting to set the content folder name to a different name also fails. Cause When the upload is performed, a FileNotFoundException is thrown. The following error is added to the device logs: > FileNotFoundException: /storage/emulated/0/Contents/ > Primary directory Contents not allowed for content://media/external_primary/file; allowed directories are [Download, Documents] Setting the content directory name to any name other than the allowed directory names will fail and result in the issue. Workaround To view the uploaded contents, set the content folder name to Documents or Download.
